attributes.action: Grant NHS workers an extra 5 days annual leave entitlement on their allowance
attributes.additional_details:
As the government repeatedly states that they are unable to endorse a pay rise for nhs staff as we have only just received one and are unable to find the funds to increase pay again. 

Currently the NHS is enduring a staffing crisis and is struggling to attract new workers to the proffesion for all parts of the NHS not just nursing and by offering an attractive annual leave entitlement may result in more people pursuing a career within the Nhs
attributes.background: Increase the annual leave entitlement for NHS staff to an additional 5 days or 37.5 hours or as pro rata equivalent on top of their current allocation.

rejection.details:
The NHS are responsible for decisions about annual leave, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We've published several petitions about rewards and recognition for NHS staff which you may wish to sign:

Give an honorarium of £1000 to all NHS staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568493

To pay every NHS and Social Care Worker in England a £500 "Thank You" Bonus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562495

Give all Nurses and lower paid NHS Staff a tax free bonus of £5000: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568198

Pay 15% bonus to public facing NHS staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570762

Recognise all members of NHS nursing profession by giving them a 12.5% pay rise: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560253

Increase pay for all NHS staff by 15%: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/565151
